xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 27 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 09:24 <sdumitriu2> has joined #phenotips 09:25 <sdumitriu1> has quit 09:26 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 09:28 <sdumitriu2> has quit 09:32 <sdumitriu1> has quit 09:46 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 09:53 <sdumitriu2> has joined #phenotips 09:53 <sdumitriu2> has quit 09:55 <sdumitriu1> has quit 11:42 <akats> has joined #phenotips 12:18 <akats> Is there a way to keep the patient network search component (the one that takes forever to load) loaded in memory? 12:20 <sdumitriu> It is kept in memory after the server restarts 12:20 <sdumitriu> But you can't keep it in memory between restarts 12:22 <akats> At some later point, when I have time, would it be ok if I figured out a way to run it as a separate process? I mean the development of anything that uses this feature would be sped up quite a bit. 12:24 <sdumitriu> I'd rather keep it inside 12:28 <akats> I had not taken a close look at what's happening, but isn't it just doing some calculations that it then stores in cache? 12:55 <sdumitriu> Yes 13:06 <SayAsh_> has joined #phenotips 13:07 <SayAsh_> has quit 13:08 <SayAsh_> has joined #phenotips 13:50 <akats> Would this be a proper way of getting a hibernate object by id session.get(OutgoingSearchRequest.class, requestId); ? 13:52 <sdumitriu> Yes 14:15 <akats> sdumitriu: I've been struggling with hibernate for a while, could you take a look at what I'm doing wrong? 14:36 <SayAsh_> has quit 15:36 <mcupak> has quit 17:17 <akats> has quit 20:45 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 21:37 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 21:55 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 23:11 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips
